title: Advanced Typography - Usage Examples
description: Creative typography with gradient fills, strokes, marquee scrolling, circular text, underline effects, and blend modes. Perfect for hero sections, creative headings, announcements.

examples.name: Gradient Stroke Text (Hero Title)
examples.description: Large heading with purple gradient stroke and transparent fill
examples.visualDescription: Bold text with 2px purple-to-pink gradient stroke outline, transparent inside, creates hollow outlined effect perfect for hero sections
examples.useCase: Hero headings, section titles, creative headers, portfolio titles
notes: strokeFill=true enables stroke effects
gradientTgl=true uses gradient instead of solid color
strokeNGColor is gradient (linear-gradient or radial-gradient)
fillNColor='transparent' creates hollow outlined text effect
Responsive strokeWidth: 2px desktop, 1.5px tablet, 1px mobile
Large font sizes (72px) work best with stroke effects

examples.name: Marquee Scrolling Announcement
examples.description: Infinite scrolling text for announcements or news ticker
examples.visualDescription: Text scrolls horizontally from right to left continuously, emojis included, speed 15s per loop, infinite repetition

examples.useCase: Announcements, news tickers, promotional banners, sale notifications, event updates
notes: marquee=true enables horizontal scrolling
marqueeDir: 'left' (right to left), 'right' (left to right)
marqueeLoop: -1 (infinite), or positive number for limited loops
marqueeAni: speed in seconds (15 = slow, 5 = fast)
Emojis work in typoText for visual appeal
Background gradient makes announcement stand out

examples.name: Circular Text Logo
examples.description: Text arranged in circular path for logos or decorative elements
examples.visualDescription: Brand name text curved along circular path, repeating pattern with separator bullets, perfect for circular logo badges

attributes.typoText: Your Brand Name â€¢ Est. 2024 â€¢ Premium Quality â€¢

examples.useCase: Circular logos, badge designs, decorative text, certificates, seals
notes: cirTextEn=true enables circular text path
cirTextPath is SVG path definition (circle formula: M centerX,centerY m -radius,0 a radius,radius 0 1,0 diameter,0 a radius,radius 0 1,0 -diameter,0)
cirTextRev=true reverses text direction (clockwise vs counter-clockwise)
Use bullet separator â€¢ for repeating pattern
Text should be repetitive with separator to fill circle
Smaller font sizes (14-18px) work better on curved paths

examples.name: Multiple Text Items with Effects
examples.description: Multiple words with different creative effects
examples.visualDescription: Three words stacked: 'Creative' with stroke outline, 'Typography' with wavy underline, 'Design' with blend mode effect
examples.useCase: Creative headlines, artistic text displays, hero sections with stacked words, portfolio headers
notes: typoListing='multiple' enables textListing array
Each textListing item has unique _key (sequential: '0', '1', '2'...)
Each item can have different effects: stroke, underline, blend mode
advUnderline='overlay' adds decorative underline (wavy, zig-zag, etc.)
overlayStyle options: 'style-1', 'style-2', 'style-3'...
blendMode creates CSS blend-mode effects (difference, multiply, screen, etc.)
All items inherit base styling but can override with own typoTypo

examples.name: Solid Stroke with Fill
examples.description: Text with colored stroke outline and solid fill (double color effect)
examples.visualDescription: Blue text with 3px white stroke outline, creates outlined effect while maintaining readable fill
examples.useCase: Headings that need to stand out on image backgrounds, high-contrast text, overlaid text
notes: gradientTgl=false uses solid colors (strokeNColor, not strokeNGColor)
strokeNColor is stroke outline color (white creates halo effect)
fillNColor is text fill color (blue for visibility)
White stroke on colored fill improves readability over busy backgrounds
3px stroke provides strong contrast without being too thick

examples.name: Hover Color Change Effect
examples.description: Text with different colors on hover for interactive elements
examples.visualDescription: Purple text that transitions to pink gradient stroke on hover, smooth color change animation
examples.useCase: Interactive links, call-to-action text, navigation elements, clickable headings
notes: tTextLink makes entire text clickable (url, target, nofollow)
strokeHGColor is hover gradient (different from strokeNGColor)
fillHColor is hover fill (semi-transparent purple tint on hover)
Smooth transition between normal and hover states
Use contrasting gradients for clear hover feedback

examples.name: Underline Effect Variations
examples.description: Creative underline styles (wavy, zig-zag, double line) on text
examples.visualDescription: Text with wavy underline decoration, customizable color and style, adds visual flair to headings
examples.useCase: Section headings, highlighted text, emphasis, decorative titles
notes: advUnderline='overlay' enables decorative underline effects
overlayStyle options: 'style-1' (straight), 'style-2' (wavy), 'style-3' (zig-zag), etc.
oulayColor defines underline color
oulayWidth: 100% spans full text width, less for partial underline
oulayHeight: thickness of underline decoration (6-10px recommended)
oulayOffset: vertical position relative to text baseline (negative = above, positive = below)

examples.name: Text with Background Clip Gradient
examples.description: Gradient fill inside text using background-clip technique
examples.visualDescription: Text filled with purple-to-pink gradient, no stroke, gradient flows through letterforms
examples.useCase: Modern headings, brand text, hero titles, colorful displays
notes: strokeFill=false disables stroke (using fill gradient instead)
gradColor=true enables gradient text fill
typoNGColor is gradient for text fill (uses background-clip: text)
Creates smooth gradient inside letterforms (not outline)
Different effect from strokeNGColor (which is outline gradient)
Works best with bold, thick fonts (800+ weight)

typoListing.multiple: Multiple text items (textListing array, each with own effects)

circularText.formula: M centerX,centerY m -radius,0 a radius,radius 0 1,0 diameter,0 a radius,radius 0 1,0 -diameter,0

blendModes.creative: Works best over images or colored backgrounds

validationRules.typoText: Required when typoListing='normal', main text content
validationRules.textListing: Required when typoListing='multiple', array of text items with _key
validationRules._key: Required for each textListing item, unique sequential: '0', '1', '2'...
validationRules.strokeFill: Boolean, if true requires strokeWidth and either strokeNColor or strokeNGColor
validationRules.gradientTgl: Boolean, if true use strokeNGColor (gradient), if false use strokeNColor (solid)
validationRules.marquee: Boolean, if true requires marqueeDir, marqueeLoop, marqueeAni
validationRules.marqueeLoop: Number, -1 for infinite, positive for limited loops
validationRules.cirTextEn: Boolean, if true requires cirTextPath (SVG path)

warnings: CRITICAL: Stroke effects require strokeFill=true (won't show without it)
CRITICAL: Gradient stroke requires gradientTgl=true + strokeNGColor (not strokeNColor)
CRITICAL: Circular text requires valid SVG path in cirTextPath (syntax errors break display)
Don't use very small stroke widths (<1px) - nearly invisible
Don't use very large stroke widths (>5px) - text becomes unreadable
Marquee with marqueeLoop=-1 loops forever (ensure user can scroll past)
Circular text works best with 12-18px font size (larger text doesn't curve well)
fillNColor='transparent' with no stroke creates invisible text
Multiple textListing items with same _key cause conflicts
advUnderline='overlay' requires overlayStyle or underline won't show
blendMode effects only visible when text is over images/backgrounds
Long typoText in circular path may overlap (keep text short or increase radius)
Marquee on mobile can be jarring (consider disabling or slowing down)
Gradient text (background-clip) not supported in very old browsers (IE11)
commonMistakes: Setting strokeFill=true but forgetting strokeWidth (no stroke appears)
Using strokeNColor with gradientTgl=true (should use strokeNGColor for gradients)
Enabling marquee without setting marqueeAni (marquee doesn't move)
Forgetting cirTextPath when cirTextEn=true (circular text doesn't render)
Using complex circular path without understanding SVG path syntax (broken display)
Setting typoListing='multiple' without providing textListing array
Not setting unique _key for textListing items (conflicts)
Setting blendMode without background (blend effect not visible)
Using very long text in circular path (overlapping, unreadable)
Not setting marqueeDir when marquee=true (defaults may not match intent)
Forgetting overlayStyle when advUnderline='overlay' (underline doesn't show)
Using incompatible colors (light stroke on light background = invisible)
Not testing on mobile (stroke widths too thick, text too large)
Using too many effects simultaneously (stroke + gradient + underline + blend = chaotic)
bestPractices: For hero titles: Use large font (60-80px) with gradient stroke + transparent fill
For announcements: Use marquee with contrasting background, speed 10-15s
For circular logos: Keep text short, use 14-16px font, repeat pattern with separators
For multiple items: Limit to 3-4 items max per block (avoid overcrowding)
Use responsive strokeWidth: 2px desktop, 1.5px tablet, 1px mobile
For readability over images: Use white stroke + colored fill (halo effect)
Choose stroke colors with high contrast to background
For gradients: Use 2-3 colors max (more colors = muddled)
Test circular text with different radius values to find best curve
For marquee: Speed 15s for promotional text, 8s for urgent announcements
Use blend modes sparingly (only when intentional artistic effect needed)
For underlines: 6-10px height, -5px to -10px offset for good spacing
Combine effects thoughtfully: stroke + gradient (good), stroke + gradient + blend + underline (too much)
Use fontWeight 700+ for stroke effects (thin fonts get lost with stroke)
For gradient text fill: Use bold fonts (800-900 weight) for best visibility
Test on dark and light backgrounds to ensure visibility
Use ariaLabel for screen reader accessibility when using decorative text
Keep marquee content concise (1-2 sentences max for readability)
For linked text (tTextLink): Use clear hover effects (fillHColor, strokeHColor)
Optimize font loading (only load font weights you actually use: 700, 800, 900)
accessibilityNotes: Use high contrast between text and background (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 ratio minimum)
Ensure stroke + fill combination maintains sufficient contrast
Gradient text should have fallback solid color for accessibility
Marquee text can cause motion sickness (provide pause control or disable for users who request reduced motion)
Circular text can be hard to read (use for decorative purposes only, provide alternative linear text)
Use ariaLabel attribute in textListing items for screen reader context
Don't rely solely on color to convey information (use text labels)
Ensure text remains readable when CSS fails to load (fallback to default styles)
For linked text (tTextLink): Provide clear focus states for keyboard navigation
Avoid pure decorative text that conveys no content (or use aria-hidden)
Test with screen readers (NVDA, JAWS) to ensure text is announced correctly
Blend mode effects are purely visual (ensure content is understandable without them)
For multiple textListing items: Ensure reading order makes sense for screen readers
performanceConsiderations: Limit textListing items to 5-10 max (each item adds DOM elements)
Marquee adds continuous animation loop (impacts battery on mobile)
Circular text uses SVG path calculations (slightly heavier rendering)
Gradient strokes with background-clip can be GPU-intensive (use sparingly)
Multiple blend modes on same page impact rendering performance
Use CSS will-change for marquee animations (improves smoothness)
Optimize font file loading (only load weights you use)
For gradient effects: Use CSS gradients instead of gradient images (faster)
Limit simultaneous animated effects (marquee + blend + stroke on one page = slow)
Test on low-end mobile devices (effects can cause lag)
Use font-display: swap in @font-face for faster perceived loading
For circular text: Cache SVG path calculations (browser handles this automatically)
Avoid very complex SVG paths in cirTextPath (simple circles are fastest)
